noun.description: The action of deducting or subtracting something.
examples: the dividend will be paid without deduction of tax

noun.description: The inference of particular instances by reference to a general law or principle.
examples: the detective must uncover the murderer by deduction from facts
we do not yet know if these deductions are correct

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin deductio(n-), from the verb deducere (see deduce).
